To elaborate on this we'll first turn away from buildings and rely on the metaphor of the skin: After all, the ornamentation of this most intimate surface is still very much part of our time. Tattoo and piercing keep ornament operative at the scale of the person; the body becomes a legible social text;

*the design and arrangement of these marks can be deciphered by others, conveying information about the individual's affiliations, values, and experiences. In this way, the skin becomes a site of self-expression and identity formation, blurring the lines between the personal and the public sphere.  As we explore this metaphor further, we may uncover new insights into the relationship between the body and the built environment.*
